page.title: 03LANDSCAPE
page.content: The land is flat and fertile.There is farming, mostly cereal growing, in hedged fields. Many hedges are very old, mostly hawthorn,oak,maple and bramble. There are many glasshouses which are part of the smallholdings where salad foods are grown. Through the fields run many ditches for drainage.There are also four rifes (tidal inlets), Keynor Rife, Mill Channel, Bremar Rife, and Pagham Rife which run through the fields. Most of Pagham Harbour is in our rectangle.When the tide is out it is a saltmarsh with mud flats and grassy humps.Many wading and sea birds live here and it has been made a nature reserve. Many buildings are made from field or beach flints, others from Mixon stone found off Selsey Bill.
